Rejected from PhD, offered consideration for MS after video interview. Was pretty flustered for the video interview and feel like I did not do well. My stats - Honors in EECS from top 5 US school, GRE 170Q/167V/5.5W, 6 years software engineering and startup experience in POI's research area but no publications & all LORs from industry. Rejected everywhere this year, should have applied to some safer schools. Congrats everyone that got in.

Good to hear this early. "Thank you for applying to Computer Science MS/PhD (Track) at the Fu Foundation School of Engineering and Applied Science. After careful evaluation of your application to Columbia University Fu Foundation School of Engineering and Applied Science, the Committee on Admissions regrets to inform you that your application for graduate study has not been approved.

It has been determined that your application may be better suited for consideration to the Master's degree program. If you would like your application to be reviewed for admission to the MS program, we ask that you please submit this form. Upon receipt of this form, you will then have the ability to complete the mandatory video interview in your status portal. Your application will be reviewed for the MS program upon completion of both the form and the video interview."

TTPB: I think the idea of schools not having to go to waitlist applies more to undergrad than grad school. I might be wrong though. Also I am curious where you got the 10% stat. I have been searching for previous Columbia CS phd waitlist cases and honestly I can't find any. BTW congrats to your other acceptances.

TTPB: From what I've read in various forums, less than 10% of people get off the waitlist. Sometimes, they don't take anyone off at all. It's a matter of pride for the schools to announce that they didn't have to go to the waitlist. And they send out acceptances to people they think are most likely to accept. So I would advise: don't get your hopes up. If you have other options, consider them. I have other acceptances and will be making a decision before the end of this week.
